post_text: We are Better Together!
shared_text:
Arlette Shannon Robinson is with Dak-Tammy Keylon and 4 others.
April 4 at 2:53 PM ¬∑

While the students are away, the teachers will play...OR will they?

No, I am so very proud of our Bradley County Schools teachers who are going above and beyond for our students, our schools, and our community. To the ones who volunteer for Essential services, from Lu Ann Gilliland Carey who has worked every sales day (without student help) and Jamey Haynes working in the greenhouses to provide the community with plants and vegetables to the Bradley County STEM team, a group of high school engineering, math/physics, mechatronics, and middle school STEM teachers who have worked every day for a week getting the Face Shield Project up and running to provide PPE to the medical community, to all the teachers and staff riding the food buses three days a week, and too many others to mention, THANK YOU!!! The halls may be empty but the teachers' hearts are full of care and concern for not only their students but their community as they serve with cheer. I think our students would be proud of them!!! Even when they are gone...We are Growing Students, Building Futures. #LearninginplaceTN

post_text: Bradley County Schools Elementary Music Educators worked together to begin to develop and write a K-5 scope and sequence for all 11 elementary schools in the district. They had met in July and August to work as a team under the direction of Music Instruction expert Susanne Burgess, Professor at Lee University. We are thankful to our teachers for taking leadership and seeking to elevate and standardize our arts curriculum programming, along with our partnership with Lee University. Full K-12 curriculum alignment and implementation is one objective of the funding provided by the State of the Arts Music Grant over the next three years. Bradley County Schools is thankful for the investment of the SOTA grant, which is a partnership between the TN Department of Education and the CMA Foundation.
